author: Yi Shu Ng
title: 500 people squeezed into the world's most epic family photo
text:
This has got to be the most incredible family photo, period.
500 descendants from one man — all with the same family name, Ren — gathered in an eastern Chinese village to take this epic group shot:
In the photo are the 25th to 31st generations of this family from Shishecun, in Zhejiang.
SEE ALSO: 78-year-old grandma makes the perfect snow angel with help from her family
The photo was taken behind the basalt formations where the village was founded 20 years ago.
It took 30 minutes for the Rens to get into position, with organiser, Ren Tuanjie barking instructions through a loudhailer.
They were able to trace the extensive family tree through 13 genealogy scrolls. It's estimated that over 1,000 people in seven generations of Rens are still alive, said Ren Tuanjie — whose name means "unity," incidentally.
Ren said he's trying to reach about a third of the 1,000 people who have left the village, in order to document them.
Weibo users were incredibly stoked about this photo:
Image: Ng Yi Shu/Mashable
LetsGoPlayqoq commented: "The youngest child is probably getting all the red packets (with money in them) until he can't take it anymore."
To which JinChiHeHua replied: "The oldest is probably bankrupt from distributing all the angpows," and JianghuEvilCantDefeat added: "You probably can get rich by being in this family."
Image: Ng Yi Shu/Mashable
NayamiXiaoJiang jokes: "Wait, did you say you're going to invite the whole family to dinner? I'll start making calls."
Image: Ng Yi Shu/Mashable
Kira_Tao: "It'll be awkward if you realised your girlfriend was in the group photo too."
